result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keriana R Mataya

records.addlTxt:
11:27 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Keriana R Mataya appeared by Zoom. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. 
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  
Court swears defendant. 
The Court goes over the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork with the Defendant on the record. 
The Defendant to fax the filled out Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork that is notarized.
Once the Court gets the form, the Court will fill out the court appointed form.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. 
The Court will adjourn.
Hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. The Defendant is not to enter any gun ranges in the State of Wisconsin.

9:03 AM Defendant Keriana R Mataya in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. 
THE COURT AUTHORIZES ZOOM FOR THE NEXT APPEARANCE.
Hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
